title: Can't convert GradientBoostingRegressor model with init set to 'zero'
body:
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AttributeError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-49-74857706c148> in <module>
      4 model = GradientBoostingRegressor(random_state=42, init='zero').fit(X_train, y_train)
      5 
----> 6 onnx_model = convert_sklearn(model, 'huber', [('input', FloatTensorType([1, X_test.shape[1]]))])
      7 save_model(onnx_model, 'lr1.onnx')
      8 sess = InferenceSession('lr1.onnx')

~/Documents/MachineLearning/onnx_projects/onnx_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/skl2onnx-1.4.9-py3.6.egg/skl2onnx/convert.py in convert_sklearn(model, name, initial_types, doc_string, target_opset, custom_conversion_functions, custom_shape_calculators, custom_parsers, options, intermediate)
    128     # Convert our Topology object into ONNX. The outcome is an ONNX model.
    129     onnx_model = convert_topology(topology, name, doc_string, target_opset,
--> 130                                   options=options)
    131 
    132     return (onnx_model, topology) if intermediate else onnx_model

~/Documents/MachineLearning/onnx_projects/onnx_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/skl2onnx-1.4.9-py3.6.egg/skl2onnx/common/_topology.py in convert_topology(topology, model_name, doc_string, target_opset, channel_first_inputs, options)
   1023                     "'{}'.".format(operator.type,
   1024                                    type(getattr(operator, 'raw_model', None))))
-> 1025         conv(scope, operator, container)
   1026 
   1027     # Create a graph from its main components

~/Documents/MachineLearning/onnx_projects/onnx_env/lib/python3.6/site-packages/skl2onnx-1.4.9-py3.6.egg/skl2onnx/operator_converters/gradient_boosting.py in convert_sklearn_gradient_boosting_regressor(scope, operator, container)
     92         cst = [float(x) for x in op.init_.constant_]
     93     elif op.loss == 'ls':
---> 94         cst = [op.init_.mean]
     95     else:
     96         cst = [op.init_.quantile]

AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'mean'
